alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:04PM MDT until further notice by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cheyenne WY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wyoming... Little Snake River near Dixon and Baggs affecting Carbon County. .Snowmelt is driving rises on the Little Snake River this week. Any additional rainfall may add to the rises. For the Little Snake River...including Little Snake River near Dixon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor to possibly Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Snake River near Little Snake River near Dixon and Baggs. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Moderate flooding occurs in many areas throughout the town of Baggs. Moderate to major lowland flooding occurs from Dixon to Baggs. Flood wave travel time to Baggs is approximately 2 to 3 hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Emergency Managers have noted river rises and bankfull impacts along the - Forecast...The river will rise up to near Moderate stage with a maximum value of 10.5 feet Monday morning. It will drop to just below 10 feet on Monday evening, but repeated rises each morning to near Moderate stage are expected on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday mornings of this coming week. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM MDT.
